website_summaries.verdict: Versatile, practical, and affordable – a quality sharpening stone by a recognizable brand that is perfect for most consumers' needs.
pros: Inexpensive, yet offers versatile dual grit of 400/1,000
Easy to sharpen and smooth most knife blades
Ready to use in as little as 5 minutes soaking in water
cons: may wear down with heavy-duty use

customer_reviews.title: Everyone in the ER was impressed with how sharp my knives are.
customer_reviews.text: I can personally verify that this will get your knives very sharp. I will spare you all the gory details, but the picture is of the instructions the ER sent me home with after stopping the bleeding and patching me up. I have to say, that’s not what I had in mind regarding “Thanksgiving tips”. So: not only will knives slide easily through spinach, but they will go through finger and fingernail like a hot knife through butter after being sharpened by this whetstone. Very clean, straight cut. Impressive, really. Just take it slow and don’t be a moron like me.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin William Heller

customer_reviews.title: Great value stone
customer_reviews.text: This is a good entry level whetstone, great to practice on, it works well. The 400/1000 grits seem to be correct. The 400 is only if the blades in bad shape, chips, etc. Using the 1000 then stropping after is enough to get you to shaving hair. It doesn't come with any sort of booklet or anything else, and the grits are not labeled. The darker side is 400, lighter side is 1000.
customer_reviews.author: Artem

customer_reviews.title: Grind the imperfections away!
customer_reviews.text: This coarse grit whetstone is great for prepping old and dull knives that need to be sharpened with a fine grit stone. One of my good knives edge looked like someone had tried to chop barbed wire. After ten minutes on each side of the stone, the edge was smooth and free of imperfections. After it hit the knife with the fine grit stone, I was cutting onions and apples like hot butter! I would soak this stone for 12-24 hours before using. It sucks water like a sponge. The surface needs to be damp when you sharpen.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Newman

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: 5 Years and still going, It's a wet stone and i'm sure in a few years I will need to replace it as they do ware out. I like the size, just set it on a hand towel and work your blade. Nice stone.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: it is pretty good. Obviously
customer_reviews.text: Assuming the local delivery person doesn't play football with the package this is shipped in, it is pretty good. Obviously, brittle. After getting used to manual sharpening methods, it is almost impossible to rival hand sharpened blades with the 'e-z' type sharpeners you see advertised. This stone gives a good difference in gritting to get a good hone on a pretty unhealthy blade and not need an entire set. It does what it should, and it does it well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Youtube Video + This = Sharp Knife!
customer_reviews.text: I watched a youtube video and spent only about 5 minutes sharpening my favorite knife and now it's razor sharp. I previously was using the "steel" that came with my knife set, but using a whetstone is what really puts a nice edge on it. The only concern is that I don't want anyone else in the house using the knife as it's ultra sharp (again)
customer_reviews.author: Frank Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Cancer and Reproductive Harm P65
customer_reviews.text: Seriously Amazon, what are you doing? You sold me a product that can cause cancer and reproductive harm? This is a product that indirectly contacts food. I didn't even bother opening it. Everyone, please don't buy this unless you are fine with having carcinogens possibly entering your food from here.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Made in CHINA!  American sounding name to disguise this
customer_reviews.text: AMAZON...Where a product is Made is Vital Information ! Require it on EVERY PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Redding

customer_reviews.title: gets my knives RIDICULOUSLY sharp
customer_reviews.text: my wife is a little afraid of using our kitchen knives now, which means i've done a good job sharpening. works equally well on cheap stamped steel knives and forged SS ones too...i have an $11 steel blade that can now cut thru ripe tomatoes with nothing more than the weight of the blade resting on top and a little back and forth
customer_reviews.author: balconio

customer_reviews.title: The darker side is the 400 side and the lighter is the 1000 side
customer_reviews.text: thia is a good stone.The 400 side and the 1000 side both respond well. I have taken knioves to a very sharp edge. with this stone. \I have lots of Naniwa stones. which are faster, but this stone will sharpen just as well as them; If you're into water stone give this one a try you wont be dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stone for the monies, hair shaving sharp in minutes with pocket knives!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Just got it today, sharpened two pocket knives, one a 8Cr13MoV Chinese steel, the other s30v American steel The stone made short work of both steels (which were pretty sharp already). But notably was able to make the s30v hair shaving sharp easily, something I've had trouble with. Inexpensive and useful, I love this stone. It's not the Ninja sharp 8000+ grits that you can find, but for pocket knives and EDC, it's perfect and inexpensive. Get One!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: syrik

customer_reviews.title: Good coarse soaking stone for great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stone because I needed a coarse stone to go with my king kw-65 1000/6000 combo. While that stone is great, I needed a coarse stone like this 400 side to bring my dull VG high carbon steel harder knives back to sharp. I chose this stone b/c of price and favorable reviews (by burrfections on YouTube). I've used it for two knives now. Found the stone easy to use with good feedback. A bonus of adding a second coarser stone, it is useful to keep your other stone flat.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME VALUE
customer_reviews.text: For $10 this is the absolute best stone you can buy. Would recommend for two types of people: 1. People looking for a cheap and effective option to sharpen their knives (which is the majority of folks) 2. People looking for a cheap 400-grit stone which also happens to have a 1000-grit side to sharpen cheaper knives or practice your sharpening skills without wearing out your more expensive stones. PROS: - Very accurate grit rating - Decent cutting speed - Very nice feel for a cheap stone - Price is unbeatable THINGS THAT COULD BE IMPROVED: - Would add a bit of size and increase price to $14 - Would add the grit numbers on the sides of the stone
customer_reviews.author: G. Abella

customer_reviews.title: It works, but with caveat (possibly)
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a 5-inch knife that I bought in Japan a couple years back. I wet the stone, did the lighter side first. Ran the knife on both sides to get an even sharpen. I'd re-wet whenever I felt necessary. Then I used the darker side of the stone and ran the knife a couple of times, probably about 10 times on both faces of the knife. I'll say the knife is sharper, but it also chipped a tiny portion of it. It might've been the way I sharpened the knife, but I did do the 20 degree angle recommended to hold the knife while sharpening it.
customer_reviews.author: naturallyfrozen

customer_reviews.title: Sharpens my knives well
customer_reviews.text: I had a knife sharpener, the kind you run your knives through, which ruined a couple of my knives. They were dull and an absolute horror to use to cut anything. So I got this Whetstone, worked hard for close to an hour on both knives and they turned out even better than before! Cuts through paper like butter. It's been a month since I last sharpened them and they are still very sharp! I cook daily and use my knives a lot so I'm definitely glad I got this Whetstone.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Care for them and they’ll last for years.
customer_reviews.text: I received this and other whetstones as a Birthday Gift. I’ve used them on kitchen knives and two Benchmade Pocket Knives. It was perfect for my needs. The stones are high quality and give excellent results. If you’re not fussy, just use a simple, cheap knife sharpener. But, if you’re particular and have high quality knives, buy this stone, take your time and sharpen to a high finish. Personally, I enjoy sitting for 15-20 minutes with an expensive knife and ending with something that performs flawlessly. A very sharp knife not only performs better but it’s less likely to cut you because it cuts easily with little pressure.
customer_reviews.author: BP Bob

customer_reviews.title: No need to buy new knifes.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really fast with a knife, especially a chef knife! This stone got my old knife so sharp, I use the back of my finger nails to glide. This thing is cutting shreds of the back of my finger nail like I’m pealing potatoes! now I bet I can cut a tin can with this. I thought I would have to use a grinder. you know the one in a workshop to get this knife sharp again, not this thing no need!!! Its like a razor blade. My blade is about 14 years old!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S

customer_reviews.title: If you're new to this...
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm once you get the hang of it. I have sharpened several kitchen knives as well as pocket knives with this whetstone. If you've never sharpened a knife with a whetstone before, I'd recommend watching a few YouTube videos on how to do it. You need to hold the blade at the right angle and drag it over the stone in just the right way. Otherwise you could be working against yourself. I didn't realize how dull my kitchen knives were, and they're not that old. Even going a year without sharpening then was too long.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Anglea

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.  DOES IT EVER do what it's supposed to!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have never owned a sharpening stone before. But after owning one, I can say I'll never be without one ever again! ALL of those sharpening gadgets you've seen, they all suck! If it's not a stone like this, don't bother. Get yourself one of these things and, depending upon how anal you are, every knife in your kitchen will be sharp in no time. Sharpening a knife with a wet stone is oddly therapeutic and seems to relieve stress. Although, that could be one of the tell-tale signs of psychosis!
customer_reviews.author: Beauzeau

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpening stone
customer_reviews.text: Watch a few videos on YouTube and your knives will be sharper than new. I found a plastic container that fits it perfectly so I keep mine soaking in water until I need it. My friends always come to me to get their knives sharpened. Coincidentally, this makes a great gift for those same people. This will get the blade sharp but to finish it I use a 6k grit stone to polish the edge to shaving sharp.
customer_reviews.author: John Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this stone. I soak in a small plastic takeout food tray for 10 minutes and ready to go. After using, my beautiful Shun knives are back to perfection. Because the steel is so hard, it takes time to bring the edge back (about 12 minutes on the 1000 side; knives were not dull enough to require 400). I also used this on more beat up knives and again made them razor sharp after both sides of the stone. Just a finish with honing steel and I could shave. Great stone for the $12 paid! No reason to buy more expensive stones.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Why you need a whetstone in your kitchen or workroom
customer_reviews.text: Swipe your kitchen knife across this simple producer 4 or 5 times at regular intervals. You will be rewarded with a smooth, sharp cutting edge that works well. The edge is not so razor sharp as an electric sharpener. This is a Good thing. The electric sharpeners give a razor edge that slices into your finger before you know it. The whetstone sharpens the edge to a good, working sharpness that works without the increased danger of regular cuts on the fingers. A three second swipe every few times you use the knife keeps the edge just right.
customer_reviews.author: M. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: rendering both sides useless.
customer_reviews.text: I tried sharpening a plane blade but couldn't. I then checked to see if the stone was flat, and it wasn't even close. It was noticeably convex on one surface, and it had a logo on the other, rendering both sides useless.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sharpening Stone at an Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfectly flat, large, straight knife sharpening stone that produces excellent results with a relatively course side and a fine side for honing the edge. Too heavy to be portable tub that wasn't a requirement for my purposes. Works great on the kitchen knives. (I probably could use a full-size grindstone for my swords, but I'm guessing that most folks don't much care about such things.) If you're not used to sharpening your own blades, you might want to peruse some of the bazillion on-line videos available. Wet the stone before you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Basic Wet stone
customer_reviews.text: Like 3 stars indicate, it's okay. No instructions came with my stone, I had to check the internet to see which side to use first. Soaking in water prior to use is a bit of a pain, but I've got my technique down and I can get my Chef's Knife sharp, along with several other kitchen knives. While I have not tried pocket knives yet, it should do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: A COBOL Guy

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This item met my needs. It's very well made and should last a long time. I've recently gotten into knives and have a small collection. I've been learning the process of sharpening which is a lot of fun! The item is super heavy and feels premium.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a keen edge for your knife?
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used this stone for "coarse" and "fine" sharpening of a variety of different blade types: Swiss knives, buck knives, kitchen knives, and a small hand axe. The stone is just that, a stone, and requires some practice (or prior knowledge) before you get a keen edge on your knife. If you're looking for a product that sharpens the knife with a pull across the sharpener, this product is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: GrimbleGrumble

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This stone is great for sharpening kitchen knives, machetes, pocket knives, scissors, and even hair clippers. I've used mine for all of the above and turned my 10 year old kitchen set into a brand new one. A quick YouTube search does help as each blade style has it's own technique and if not done correctly will dull the blade versus sharpen it. This was my first experience with a whetstone and I have quickly moved up to an immediate user with some online coasching and practice. I refuse to use a dull blade again, and after this purchase I know I won't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in perfect condition wrapped in bubble wrap. I used the 400 side followed by the 1000 side on a few of my knives that needed some TLC. Now my knives are sharp again!! Some reviews show that their blocks are more used in the middle and not on the edges. This is mostly user error. Try to use the entire stone face to sharpen your knives and this won't happen! This is a great stone for the money. I used on some cheaper knives, so I cannot speak for using this stone on fancier, expensive knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better shipping needed
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this and it came broken in the mail today. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kye T.

customer_reviews.title: Very soft. Too soft for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: 1. The stone is very soft. If your angle changes slightly you can gouge the stone. I bumped it against my faucet and chipped it. 2. The grit doesn't feel right. The 400 grit feels like 600 The 1000 grit side feels like 1500 to 2000. In the end; it wasn't all that expensive and it gets the job done. I will continue to use it until it is unusable. It is the only whetstone under 1000 grit that I own and it is good for reshaping a blades edge. I will probably check out a different brand when it is time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Printed name = Dead spot
customer_reviews.text: This thing wouldbe an easy 5 star review - if they didn't print their name on the top of it! It's a lovely useless spot right on top (and in the middle) of the stone. Luckily it has finally started rubbing off after a lot of use. The picture has the name on the side, and hopefully they started putting it there.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Good for the kitchen, tools, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: This stone seems to be best used with small blades and kitchenware. Upon testing on larger blades and axes, I found it to be subpar compared to other stones I've used. With proper usage, I was able to put a decent edge on my kitchen knives no problem. It isn't the most durable stone either, but it does its job so I give it a solid 4.
customer_reviews.author: James Eximiris

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stone to sharpen my fleshing knives. It does a sufficient job, but this stone is extremely soft, and one must take care when using on a heavy fleshing knife otherwise there is a tendency to nick the stone with the blade. I have multiple whetstones, and none are as soft as this one. While it might last me a lifetime, I am not sure I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: H. E. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this stone to sharpen my clipper blades that I have never sharpened for several years. After a few minutes, the blades are like new! It might be all in my head, but while sharpening, it’s almost as if I could feel the imperfections being ground away until it was smooth across the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hedlund

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price; Wear seemed rapid compared to similar stones
customer_reviews.text: Wears a bit fast for hobbyists interested in sharpening daily. That being said, the quality of abrasive, level of bond strength, and crisp feedback are better than some budget stones I have that don't wear as rapidly. And, of course, the wear may well have been the result of error on my part - my hand can get as heavy as the next guy's if my attention slips. All in all, 100% worth the price of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: InevitableBlindLeap

customer_reviews.title: Used to sharpen a hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately there are no instructions whatsoever that came with this tool, but thankfully there in the item description online. My hatchet was very dull to begin with, but after an hour if using the stone it was almost back to original condition. It works great for pocket knives too (obviously works much faster for smaller blades). Great investment and much cheaper than in stores. This was my first time using it, but not too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Must have for beginner’s honing stone collection!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very surprised of the grit and quality. I have purchased some mini honing stones and the 400 grit compare to this one was night and day! It’s a must have for beginners to hone chipped and severely dull edges. I use the 400 grit to speeds up the process to get a uniform edge, then I would flip it over for 1,000 grit, then I move on to the 3000,4000 then finally 8000...
customer_reviews.author: Mike LasVegas

customer_reviews.title: Great stone, remember to soak it for 10 mins and you'll be good to go
customer_reviews.text: Just soak it for 10 mins at least and keep it wet throughout your sharpening and this thing is great. Gets my knives nice and sharp where I can finish off with a strop and get great shaving results.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: All you need for light duty sharpening
customer_reviews.text: My wife does not want me to sharpen household knives too sharp to be able to cut paper. The stone is more than adequate to adjust improper edge and put some polishing at the end. I put it on my wooden cutting board over the sink secured by towels at both ends since there is no non-slip silicon padding provided. My higher grit stone was essentially retired since. The stone surfaces are smooth with no logo.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ko

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hone a Katana for cutting practice, but was on a budget. It does alright, but you'll want to set up somewhere you're not afraid to get messy, use distilled water, and constantly be adjusting when slipping. I highly suggest practicing with some old knives that aren't rusty but need sharpening before moving to something larger.
customer_reviews.author: NinjaBraap

customer_reviews.title: A quality 2 grit stone. Excellent results
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I need to mention is a whetstone is not for an impatient beginner. This is an excellent whetstone. Perfectly package. Arrived in great shape. If it is your first one watch a video. It takes neither a genius nor a chef. The satisfaction you get giving your knives a perfect edge without the sound of some machine grinding them down is simpatico
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Far better than double sided pocket sharpeners.
customer_reviews.text: I ran my new Mora through a doublesided pocket sharpener and it dulled the crap out of it. I pulled out this stone and stroked the blade about 30 times on each side of the blade on the 1000 grit. The edge was perfect. I kind of wish I got the 1000/3000 grit stone, but the 400 grit will be perfect for sharpening axes or really dull blades.
customer_reviews.author: ThrowinStacks

customer_reviews.title: OUCH! Razor sharp knifes.
customer_reviews.text: Great sharpinging block for dull knifes. Soak it for a couple of mins, hold it at an angle and go at it. I highly suggest searching YouTube of you have never done this before. I promise that you will turn ever knife into a butter knife if not used properly. Con: only if it came with a non-slip base for the price. Besides that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Hancel

customer_reviews.title: Broken, but packaged & sold anyway --- MADE WHOLE BY SELLER
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged, with a corner broken off. The missing corner was not in the package, meaning it was broken before being put in the original packaging. Either poor quality control, or this company simply does not care about selling broken products - disappointing either way. The side that is not broken seems to work, so I can use part of it, but not as intended or paid for. EDIT: I was contacted by the seller and received a replacement product. The second item was fully as expected when originally purchasing the item. I am revising from 2-stars to 4-stars
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Maybe too soft?
customer_reviews.text: This stone might be a bit too soft to be really useful for sharpening. I've sharpened my kitchen knives with a Rc of ~58 and I can't seem to form a consistent Burr while sharpening. I've been freehand sharpening for years and I have the technique but after about a half hour I always end up going back to my DMT Dia-sharp stones
customer_reviews.author: Cody Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Makes dull knives sharp
customer_reviews.text: I got this stone for kitchen use. My wife buys cheap knives that suck at holding an edge, so I have to sharpen them often. This is my tool of choice. I didn't research it or anything. Just got it and it works. It is the largest sharpening stone I've ever used, but that just makes it easier. 5 stars because it does its job and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Beauvais

customer_reviews.title: Not for Gerber strong arm
customer_reviews.text: I could not get a sharp edge on a Gerber strong arm for the life of me. I'm a absolute beginner. Tried various angle. Strokes. Just got uneven edges. It will cut, but won't shave hair off my arm. I'm probably doing it wrong. Can't help but feel this stone isn't cutting it either though
customer_reviews.author: SW2

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpening stone
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stone for sharpening dull knives. I use a Chosera 800 for regular sharpening but when I get a knife that needs a little heavier sharpening, I start it on this 400 grit and it's fantastic. It's a fast cutting stone and surprisingly inexpensive. I never use the 1000 side because I have an 800 already, but the 400 side works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Are you just learning to sharpen? Are you interested in whetstones? This is where you should start. You'll likely chew your first knife up and you'll probably wreck this stone. But that's exactly how you learn! So if you're a beginner get this first. And once you get the method down, go ahead and look for a King stone or something similar to that. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Paskal

customer_reviews.title: Easy simple effective
customer_reviews.text: I don't know anything about knives or sharpening them but getting this just seemed so much more practical than buying an electric one. Sharpened a folding knife I use for work for maybe 30 seconds and noticed it was much sharper and easy to use the next day at work (I work in construction). Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Akoma714

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not 400 Grit
customer_reviews.text: The stone was supposed to be 400 grit, it says it is 400 grit. there is no possible way that it is 400 grit, it is much higher. Both sides also have the same grit based on feel. I guess that is what I get for buying a stone from a random Chinese factory on Amazon (I Feel like this is becoming a common occurrence on this website ).
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Camiliere

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I've used the automatic sharpening devices in the past but this stone works better in my opinion. Keep it under a little bit of running water while you're sharpening, and you're good to go! I do have to re-sharpen the knives every few weeks. Not sure if that's normal or because my knives are cheap. Probably the latter.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: The stone came broken. I can still use it but this is what i get for ordering cheap stones
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: ... job sharpening all of our kitchen knives to the best shape they’ve been in since we got them 14 ...
customer_reviews.text: This did the job sharpening all of our kitchen knives to the best shape they’ve been in since we got them 14 years ago. It isn’t a fast process; I probably should have started with a lower grit as bad as my knives were. This is a “soft” stone and I definitely see some wear after going through all my knives, but it should last many years now that it will be maintenance instead of reconditioning
customer_reviews.author: ncsw

customer_reviews.title: Quality not there
customer_reviews.text: I had a stone from culinary school that I used to use but lost, for my kitchen knives. It wasn't the easiest stone I've used to get an edge on my knife. Then I found the old stone and what a difference. Didn't realize there could be such a difference in quality, and my old stone is 40 years old!
customer_reviews.author: mick

customer_reviews.title: Just abelow average sharpening stone.
customer_reviews.text: Some what disappointed in Whetstone knife sharpener stone. My dad always kept a sharp knife and used his Whetstone. He would have toss this poor stone in the river.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker Jack

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this stone 4 times fully since ive bought it, and it has already started chipping at the corners. This does not come with a base, and honestly, if you care about your knives to upkeep them, mind as well invest in something that comes with one or a vice. I think the 400 grit side is starting to indent as well. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and very good stone
customer_reviews.text: I am a hand sharpening enthusiastic and I love this stone. After watching some YouTube reviews I decided to buy this stone, today I have more stones but this stone is definitely the best stone in the range of price up to $30. If you have $50 go for a cerax 1000, single grid, but if you want to spend less and still want to have a good stone... whetstone cutlery is the stone to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kieu

customer_reviews.title: NICE...Very powerful sharpener.
customer_reviews.text: I love my sharpener. It really works well. It took me a little time to figure out how to use it because there were no instructions included, but there was a description of what the 2 different sides stand for. The instructions were actually on Amazon, they come to you when you order the sharpener. You must soak the stone in water for a few minutes before sharpening the knife. It fits in the kitchen drawer and is very durable. I recommend this 100%.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Best for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is by far still one of my favorite stones. I used this to learn and I will always have one. The stone does a fantastic job and is one of the most affordable. Great to keep for blade maintenance of cheaper knives if you wanted a higher class of stone for your better knives.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice and this is my first sharpening stone. It made a noticable differnce to my pocket knife. I like the abiltiy to touch a few blades up now. I'm not too worried about having the sharpest edges, but a sharper edge is much easier to cut with.
customer_reviews.author: twlightning

customer_reviews.title: As DESCRIBED
customer_reviews.text: I just recieved my whetstone a couple of minutes ago and it works fantastic! 😊 Not sure how long it'll last, hopefully a while.. The stone is super smooth, at least compared to other 400/1000 grit whetstone I've tried. I like the way it feel when you're sharpening a knife wuth this stone, like I said, very sbooth😎 it only took me like 5 minutes to sharpen a dull knife, it wasn't 100% dull but it couldn't cut paper very well😉
customer_reviews.author: Loth

customer_reviews.title: Whetstone 400 grit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and soaks water relatively fast, an awesome beginners stone and inexpensive. Only reason I didn’t give it 5 starts is because I came with a chip in one corner but I guess it’s what you get for a cheap stone. I use this to sharpen my no name brand knives.
customer_reviews.author: Ching684

customer_reviews.title: It will chip easily, which is fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm a surgeon with my straight razor. But after sharpening with this whetstone, I am upgraded to magician. Just keep it on a blanket or towel. It will chip easily, which is fine; you just have to care for it properly. One side is relatively rough, while the other is smoother...as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Six Legged Freak

customer_reviews.title: Well made Whetstone
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this knife sharpening whetstone is very nice, but the explanation on how to sharpen a knife is not really that great, I sharpened a knife using the methods listed and it didn't honestly seem that sharp... until i split my hand wide open with it. but the sharpness seems very intermittent, I do not sharpen knifes often, I have barely any knowledge on proper techniques but the quality of the product is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: David Secrest

customer_reviews.title: It's softer than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to sharpen a folding knife made of 20CV steel (an extremely hard steel). The stone got the job done, but the knife was shaving off the top layer of the stone. It worked, but I don't think this will hold up long-term without the surface becoming uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect on my first try!
customer_reviews.text: One of my kitchen knives had been getting pretty dull, so I decided to test it out with this as a first try. After about 15-20 minutes with the stone it's now the sharpest of my kitchen knives! I was pretty impressed, I'll be sharpening them all with this now, definitely worth it especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: A life-saving product!
customer_reviews.text: I believe everyone who usually cook at home has the same frustration as me when the knives get blunt. I have been searching for such product for quite a while. It’s well made and super simple to use. The whole stone look elegant too with light grey and dark grey color. I like it very much and highly recommend it to y’all. A little tip: wet the stone and knife before sharpening it. Enjoy using it!
customer_reviews.author: Claire2019

customer_reviews.title: Damaged stone but it’s useful
customer_reviews.text: Damaged, right out of the box. Wow. Takes a while to become used to using one of these, but it seems like it’s descent and doesn’t become too sandy with use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary DeBro

customer_reviews.title: Looking for cheap and durable?
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it seems to be legit. Packaging kept it safe! I'm happy with my choice!
customer_reviews.author: La Llama Blanca

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot of work but it works
customer_reviews.text: I used this on several knives and sword replicas and it works but it does take a long time to finish a blade. If you think buying this is a quick and cheap way to sharpen something you are mistaken. You will have to work for good quality even with a whetstone as nice as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Brittle and Falls appart easily! Get a naniwa chosera instead
customer_reviews.text: Whetstone fell apart way too fast and it did not cur metal as fast as I expected for a 400 grit.... my King 800 cuts more and a lot more evenly... will retire this stone after less than 6monof light usage.... dont buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Martins

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners stone!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for awhile now and it’s worked very well for me. It just takes practice getting the angles right and be sure to keep the stone moistened while using it by sprinkling water on it every few strokes. Also, let it air dry fully before storing back in box.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Microcosm

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: This item came broken on the edge in many pcs. Im not going to bother returning but possibly shows its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas E Batezel

customer_reviews.title: It works really nicely, but these are rather fine stones...
customer_reviews.text: I sharpening a typical $5-15 kitchen knife with one of these alone will take you 20-30 minutes.... So I bought a 100/200 grit handheld grindstone and it works GREAT. 100, 200, 400, 1000. I can run a knife through these four steps and get a sharp knife in 5-6 minutes. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Choi

customer_reviews.title: Great for my soap carving knife
customer_reviews.text: Has directions inside the box wich is great. It works awesome on my soap carving knife. I like it so much and had so much fun using it that i sharpened all of our knives. I'm so excited to keep using this.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Starchild

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Ive been using a stone my whole life. Never had an issue. This one got gouges on the fist use. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Zachhalstead

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Using whetstones is not easy but if you spend time working at it like anything if you practice you will get better and better. I bought this being a beginer and it takes time to get good at sharpening. It does what its suppose to if you do it right.
customer_reviews.author: RjVZ

customer_reviews.title: Knives are sharp now...finally!
customer_reviews.text: I have been eyeing whetstones for quite a while after watching several YouTube videos about sharpening knives. This one I ended up getting as a lightning deal and do not regret the purchase at all. It has worked so well my mother is now asking me to sharpen all of her knives!
customer_reviews.author: CLPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Almost seems brittle
customer_reviews.text: Stone got knife very close to being sharp enough to slice through a piece of paper. I had to use my smiths stone to get sharp enough to slice paper. Stone is very soft seems to be almost brittle. Was hopeing the thousand grit side would get knife super sharp but it did not.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: worth all the money
customer_reviews.text: i use this in boy scouts. its got 2 grits. the 400 is great for taking small chips off your blade. and the 1000 is great for a quick sharpening before a job. i live this and would recomend it to a beginer
customer_reviews.author: greg schmitz

customer_reviews.title: good knife sharpening stone
customer_reviews.text: I used it for bear cub scouts - worked fine for them.
customer_reviews.author: Pam A. Roos

customer_reviews.title: Dull blades no more!
customer_reviews.text: So easy. Works great! Why did I not buy this sooner? Suffer with dull blades no longer! Invention that's been around since the dawn of time, works way better than other products supposedly developed take over. Your scissors, knives, and garden blades will be in top form with this old fashioned perfection tool.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Ford Wilson

customer_reviews.title: May cause cancer and reproductive problems
customer_reviews.text: May cause cancer and reproductive issues? Threw it right in the trash where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay to start with.
customer_reviews.text: Depending if you like to soak the stone, it does seem Porous. Takes a while for all the tiny air bubbles to get out. Doesn’t seem like the grit count is correct but it gets the job done with a mixture of my other stones. The stone did chip, maybe my second time using it on its edge but not bad enough to hinder its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Too soft
customer_reviews.text: I am do not use stones to sharpen my tools normally, so keep that in mind. But I found the stone too soft, with far more of the stone than metal being lost. The first plane iron I sharpened developed a camber from the uneven wear of the stone - and this was it's first use. If I have to lap the stone in the middle of every use, it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. O'Pray

customer_reviews.title: Makes dull knives better than new.
customer_reviews.text: Took dull Chicago Cutlery knives and made them better than knew. Suggest watching a You Tube video to properly use it. Simple to use once you get the rhythm of turning the blade properly.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Howard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome beginner stone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 400/1000 grit stone after watching a video by burrfection on you tube comparing it to the shapton glass stones. I have sharpened 5 knives with it so far and it has been great. I used a leather strop after sharpening and have been able to get my knives shaving sharp. I still want some higher end stones, but really have no excuse to buy them right now lol.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Big O'Cranky

customer_reviews.title: Worthless hunk of garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is a hunk of junk. It can;t even put an edge on a pocketknife. Spend money to get a good stone instead
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hollister

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had a stand or something to keep it from moving.
customer_reviews.text: As a whetstone it works well. I personally just suck butt at sharpening. The only real complaint I have for this is that I don't have the means to keep it steady. If it had a stand, it would be a lot better. I had to hot glue some stuff to my sink so keep it in place and drip water on it while sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: th30be

customer_reviews.title: Much bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to sharpen my pocket knives. When I received it I was very surprised at how large it is. If you are looking for a small stone for pocket knives this is a bit big. Other than the very large size it works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J Webb

customer_reviews.title: My knives are razor sharp now
customer_reviews.text: Got this stone today and sharpened my Old Hickory knives and they are razor sharp now-if you need a sharpening stone don’t pass it up-I’m gonna get another one for a spare 👍
customer_reviews.author: Pam-Paw

customer_reviews.title: I keep my disposable blades razor sharp longer
customer_reviews.text: This product extends the life of my disposable blades in my utility knife. Reduces the number of times I have to change blades and saves times. a couple passes at the beginning of each day and the blades stay Razor sharp!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: stone
customer_reviews.text: You couldn't ask for a better product. The stone has two different sides. When sharping be careful or you may end up cutting yourself. I should of bought this a long time ago. Works great, especially on sizers.
customer_reviews.author: loriwest

customer_reviews.title: Made my knives dull
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. This whetstone made my knives more dull. It didn’t sharpen anything
customer_reviews.author: Star Cray

customer_reviews.title: I love this, but regret that it will likely only ...
customer_reviews.text: Every block needs one. I say block and not home because surely we could share amongst neighbors, no? I love this, but regret that it will likely only be used for a total of 45 min in my life time. Can we do a tool library in the neighborhood please?
customer_reviews.author: Santos Barely

customer_reviews.title: Saves me money instead of buying an expensive knife
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this stone, i was contemplating on buying newer more expensive knives but i wanted to give this cheap product a try. After watching a couple of youtube vids on how to properly use this i gave it a shot. The cons: you need to spend a lot of time sharpening your knife. But if you are like me who enjoy this kind of stuff its ok. The pros: it works and its cheap. Very good value for your $$$
customer_reviews.author: Christine de Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I started with this stone. Then 10 minutes of the 3000 grit, 10 minutes of the 8000 grit, then polished with a cloth. My knives are like new. This works on the cheapo knifes or the $300 A10 stainless knife. The stone is bubble wrapped, put into a fitted box, then put into a shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today. My only experience being a few YouTube videos on how to use a whetstone. Now my knives are sharper than when I bought them new. This thing works really well, but be prepared to spend a good 15 minutes minimum per knife if you want the job done right.
customer_reviews.author: Ilovebooks

product_meta.title: Whetstone Cutlery 20-10960 Knife Sharpening Stone-Dual Sided 400/1000 Grit Water Stone-Sharpener and Polishing Tool for Kitchen, Hunting and Pocket Knives or Blades by Whetstone
product_meta.description: Color:Original versionThe double sided 400 and 1000-grit Water Stone Sharpening Block by Whetstone enables you to safely and easily sharpen and polish your kitchen cutlery, hunting or pocket knives, blades and razors. You can even use it for your gardening tools! This stone only requires water, no oil needed! Made with durable green silicon carbide, this honing tool will last for years to come.
feature_bullets: DUAL SIDED SHARPENING- Made from durable silicon carbide, this two-sided sharpening block comes with both a 400-grit side, used for returning edges to their original shape, and a 1000-grit side used for smoothing and polishing cutting edges.

WATER STONE- This stone is meant to be used with water, not oil. Simply soak stone for 5-10 minutes before use, and lubricate with additional water as needed when sharpening. No expensive honing oil needed!

MULTI USE TOOL- This whetstone can be used as a one-stop shop for any item you want sharpened and polished, including kitchen cutlery, scissors, hunting or pocket knives, blades, and razors. Also works for hatchets, axes, carving and gardening tools.
RESTORES SHARPNESS- After one use with this water stone, dull knives and battered blades will be restored to razor sharpness. Recondition all your tools with this kitchen or workshop essential.
Dimensions: 7” (L) x 2.25” (W) x 1.125” (H). Material: Green Silicon Carbide. Features include: 2-sided stone block, Dark Green: 400 Grit, Light Green: 1000 Grit.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,955 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
